Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hereby \Here*by"\, adv. 1. By means of this. [1913 Webster]
And hereby we do know that we know him. --1 John ii. 3. [1913 Webster]
2. Close by; very near. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]
hereby adv : (formal) by means of this; "I hereby declare you man and wife" [syn: {herewith}]
